Not a big fan of the tower setting, and I would recommend Oath and Ys Chronicles over this, but the gameplay is still ridiculously fun and there's a lot of content.

Ys Origin (and the Ys series for that matter) is an odd combination of RPG/Platform/Puzzler but that doesn't stop it from being a surprisingly enjoyable game.

The RPG elements are light, with upgradable equipment, attack choices and bonuses to pick up from defeated monsters in a arcade style way of handling temporary buffs. Story-line wise, there's nothing ground breaking here with some 'world is ending, must save it' fayre but the dialogue between characters is strong and there's just enough intrigue implied throughout to make you want know what's going to happen next.

On the downside, some may find the combat element repetitive but it is fast paced and the dearth of creatures with their different attack patterns should keep things interesting. Boss battles on the other hand are a different kettle of fish, bold and brash with more than a nod to old school 90's boss fights they are tricky and engaging, providing you with a real sense of achievement when you finally succeed in downing the overseer blocking your path.

Graphically it's not going to win any awards, lets be honest, it's functional but plenty of set pieces (normally coupled in with the boss fights mentioned above) provide the highlights in what is an average looking game. However the art style has it's own unique character which has been maintained since the original release of Ys, which is charming and beautiful all the way through.

This is a solid game, plenty to keep you occupied and with a meaty enough story for each of the playable characters to deserve a playthrough, which is all well and good as if you're out hunting achievements, multiple playthroughs await you. Give it a look, especially if it's on sale, you'll be glad you did.
A surprisingly amusing beginning of a good series. Very cheap bundle of time-consumption.
For $20, this is a steal of a deal.  Ys games are simple and fun, with great storylines.  The localization is guaranteed to be top notch.

I bought this game in a steam sale not knowing much of what to expect... i was blown away - this is probably one of the most fun basic action jrpg style games i've ever had the joy of wasting life on.
AWSOME HACK N SLASH ACTION RPG IMO ...PUZZLES...CHALLENGING BOSS BATTLES...AWSOME MUSIC....GREAt gameplay good ...story line

This is a good game. The combat is simple but fun. There's a few different characters to play through as. The story is simple but nice. If you've played the other Ys games (mainly Ys I & II), there are some cute references to them here, but playing them is not required to understand the story and enjoy the game.\n\nAlso, this game has a great soundtrack.

Can't really place why Origin stands out as my favourite in the Ys series, but it just does. The gameplay is fast, fun and fluid and the boss fights are challenging yet rewarding. Youre standard enemies are easy to kill and don't provide much of a challenge at all, they really only exist to grind if you want to when the bosses start kicking you ♥♥♥. Three main story characters, all of which have unique fighting styles and individual stories, really help to make the game feel whole.

On their own, the stories are jagged and a bit weak. The writing is VERY amateurish in my opinion, but that adds to the charm of the game. The sometimes hilariously bad dialogue makes it feel as though you're playing through an early 90's anime, but the incredible combat makes up for it.

It's a fast paced game but definitely not for everyone. If you're hesitatnt, i'd recommend checking out some gameplay footage or waiting until it goes on sale.
Fun.\nThe Twins are cute.\nvery enjoyable game!
I'll break the keyboard!! ARGH!

Fast-paced jumping, dodging, hack-n-slashing RPG. Despite the unskippable cutscenes, dialogue and such, it's a pretty good challenging and fun game. I would recommend a gamepad to play with it since the default controls for pc are unbearable to use or you could try to config the controls to your preference.

definitely one of my favourite action rpgs ever. responsive combat, with plenty of features and the graphics are quite good for the time. but story is probably not one of its strongest points, its not bad but you can kinda see a plot twist coming and this is after playing both ys on steam.

this game also has one of the best soundtracks in an ARPG. but what really makes this game is so f*cking good is the bossfights.
every ys ive played has exciting bossfights that really pump your brain. im not exactly the most hardcore gamer out there, so to me the difficulties are just right and every death is fair since you probably just screwed up dodging that laser or over jumped something.

would totally hope for another ys on steam.

Do you want twitch gameplay?

Do you want a game where, the better your do, the faster you progress?

Do you want a game where you can play 3+ times and get 3 stories?

Then buy Ys Orgiin. It's a complete blast of an action RPG. You whack at enemies, and the more you do it in succession, the higher your XP multiplier goes - and therefore, the stronger your character will be.  It combines old-world arcade games with new-type action RPGs.

I've rarely had this much fun with any other Steam-available game.
hardcore boss fighting action
If you played Ys: The Oath in Felghana" and loved it
date: you'll love this too. More action platforming at it's best with a longer playthrough time then it's predecessor and multiple characters to play as for increases replayablility."

reviewText: This game shows how to make grinding, hacking and charging at monsters 24/7 fun and enjoyable.
Enjoyed playing this game, great retro style and good replay value, recommend getting if you like these style games.

A great trip back to the good old times. Interesting and beautiful characters, great story and lots of dungeon crawling and monster slaying with Zelda style, what else is needed?\nOh, yes! Great soundtrack that sucks you in the beautiful melodies and guitar riffs!\nYs:Origin is the Fantasy Adventure, RPG, Hack and slash of the old golden times made for this genereation!

I once finished Ys 3: Wanderers from Ys on both the Snes and Genesis and it became a classic gem in my gaming history. So then, I picked up the serie again when I saw the Ys serie on Steam... And it's still the same Ys feeling I remember.\n\nPicture playing an old Zelda game... with faster gameplay, jumping, good music, hack and slash with animé. That is Ys. It feels like a good 90's game, and the 90's were great. So yes, I liked it. And you pronounce Ys ease". Bonus points for a French intro. A-"

Liked this Ys as well. After playing Oath I was a little put off that the whole game takes place in a single tower, but once I played it a bit was a fun game and I didn't mind that fact or even noticed. Another old school rpg.
Damn, this game is FUN!\n\nhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S1mbYKlWu-M&feature=player_profilepage

Good action rpg game, it has a nice story and a good level of challenge (well, at least if you don't play on Very Easy). It offers a good number of unlockables (extra characters, extra modes and multiple difficulties) and it has a good replay value too. You'll keep replaying the game to unlock everything, and every time you'll have something different or new. The sprites (anime style) are good too. Grindind may become frustrating at higher diffs though... bosses in particular can be very challenging. Recommended.
Sometime you're just looking for a game where you just relax and beat the hell out of something without thinking too much.\n\nThis is a great game for that!
An incredible action RPG experience. Probably my favorite Ys title since book 1 & 2.

There are several reasons you should invest in this game.
1: It has the old school RPG feel mixed with Legend of Zelda.
2: The gameplay is superb and the storyline stays pretty linear and detailed throughout.
3: The opening animation is long, but worth the gander for a new game.
4: Ys is a franchise that has been around for years, and still to this day have a loyal and dedicated fan base. Can Square Enix and Final Fantasy say that?
Finally: It will keep you entertained for hours.

I want this game to be the first I reccomend because it deserves no less. Ys Origin has it all: adjustable challenge through many different difficulty levels, many different gaming modes, extremely high replay value through the stories of the three main characters, which should be played in this order: Yunica, Hugo and the third char, each one with a more surprising and amazing story than the previous one, reaching the peak with the third char's story, the canon one, that both blows and completes the other two's stories at the same time. Enjoy the perfect atmosphere that this game has to offer, exploring a dangerous tower while interacting with allies and enemies, making your way towards the surprising ending. So, suck that, Castlevania X; the RPG-platform genre has a new king. To whoever reads this: don't miss this game by any means.

Great art.
Great music.
Great story.
Great replayability.
Great difficulty. You can choose from A bit too easy" all the way up to "Why am I even doing this? Please stop me."
Great nostalgia (your experience may differ).
Great fun.
Great opinions sold seperately."
If you're a fan of Action RPG's, I highly recommend this game.

Entertaining gameplay
Really strong narrative
Damn good music for its time
Challenging game that can last like 20hours+
...Um there are a few noticeable problems holding it back so it  Won't astound everyone, but IT IS worth your time and cash
P sweet game, really cheesy story/music but you can kill everything

Fantasic game. It's an excellent prequel to Ys 1&2. It does a great job leading into the other games in the series if you've never played them, and ties up all the loose ends if you have played them. All difficulty levels pose some level of challenge, even on the easiest setting, which keeps with the Ys tradition of hair-pulling moments. This game really appeals to me as an avid Ys enthusiast because of all the refernces to Ys 1&2 that aren't story related. Obviously, as a prequel, many story elements have a lot to do with the events of other games, but it's the more subtle references that I enjoy. I especially liked the fact that most of the bosses are from the original games, but the fights are different. I get to see the familiar names and remember my experiences from the original games but have unique and refreshing fights with them. Also, the rendition of Termination" in this game is completely kickass."

Epic music, finely tuned action, Classic storyline, anime sequences, and just the right amount of difficulty. The Ys series didn't become so popular for no reason, and Ys Origin doesn't fail to comply.
Fantastic game, can't believe I never heard of it before it went on sale. Would recommend to anyone, I find it plays best with a controller :)

This game is just... wow ! Graphisms and artwork are great, the ost is good (some music like the boss theme for exemple are epic !), the storyline... well he's average for Yunica and Hugo but a bit more interesting for the secret character we can play once we finish the game for the first time (That tempts to play, doesn't it ?). As usual, there are 5 difficulty modes (Very easy until nightmare) and I find this opus a little easier than The Oath in Felghana". The game (only 1 storyline) in "normal" difficulty ends in 12-13 hours but if you want to do the game at 100%
date: Ys Origin will occupy you approximately 50-60 hours. He's not expensive

reviewText: This game really brigs me back to the SNES days of action RPGs. It has great, smooth gameplay, fantastic replayability, and a decent story. I've yet to play others in the series, but this game was a blast and a challenge!
Good game over all. Boss fights are amazing.

Ein Jump and Run Rollenspiel aus dem Hause Falcom.\nYs Origin spielt 700 Jahre vor Ys I & II Chronicle.\nBestreite mit Hugo und Yunica die Abenteuer auf der Suche nach den Zwilingsgöttinnen Reah und Feena im Darm Tower und besiege die Dunklen Mächte und entdecke freischaltbare Geheimnisse.
Played this when it came out in japan, didn't understand much then, but its a heck of a lot of fun :)

The game is extremely fun the only problem is the 10 minute intro at the beginning that you cannot skip and it has subtitles considering it is in a different language.\n\nOverall I do enjoy the graphics they're adorable and the gameplay is a lot of fun. Though I do not reccomend it if cutscenes easily bother you since that is the first 10 minutes of the game.
cool play it
fun game.  a nice addition to the ys series.  Not as good as ark of napishtum, but still pretty good game.  Glad it got onto steam.

The Ys series is, from what I recall, one of the big names in the Action RPG circuit, and Ys Origin changes the original formula of the first game (Ys 1 and 2, technically the second being an extension of the first rather than a separate game) by making it more actiony than RPG-y if that makes even the slightest bit of sense (it doesn't).

That being said, this is still a rather fun game to play. The story's nothing to cry home about, but it's engaging enough to make you want to learn more about characters. Basically an okay plot, points for that.

Gameplay is fantastic; three unique characters that each get their own special abilities and varied fighting styles, as well as boss battles that are tailored to their story rather than set bosses (though set bosses still appear). Again, more actiony than RPG-y, but it makes it fun.

The music helps carry the game, since it almost obviously coined the term rpg combat music". It is literally as generic fantasy-rock as you can get. I swear this is how a music company got its start. The music still helps the game move along.

Overall a rather fun game to play
date: and one of the few I've played multiple times just to see everything. The other Ys games are about as good
recommended: so if you have money to burn
hoursPlayed: this is worth it
voteText: but definitely get it on sale if you can."

reviewText: Not a big fan of the tower setting, and I would recommend Oath and Ys Chronicles over this, but the gameplay is still ridiculously fun and there's a lot of content.

A big fan of Ys, and this game definitely lives up to the name.  While it might not feature Adol it is definitely worth playing as it adds to a lot of the backstory.  If you like action RPGs and awesome music, check this bad boy out!

Being a long time Ys fan since the Turbo Grafix days, I was floored to learn that there was a game here on STEAM that i have never played before.  Well 150+ games later this game has made me a PC Gamer. Ys Origins was a fun, simple, action RPG game that i remember all the others to be like, but added story info that is needed for the series.  Any fan of Ys MUST play this game.

If you like beat em up games or RPGs, this game might just be the game for you! Features a pretty interesting story, multiple playable characters, plenty of items/upgrades and a challenging difficulty level (dependent on game mode of course).

So I know I haven't gotten very far into this, but I will say this: If you are a fan of old school hack and slash games like Illusion of Gaia, or Terraigma or even the other games in the Y's series I'd say pick this up. It's simple, fluid controls make combat a breeze, the light RPG elements and combos are fun and the story it self actually holds up pretty well and surprised me at the production values and what I saw! I mean this is not multi-million dollar production, but it does have cut scenes, like-able characters and even some psuedo anime/cg thrown in for good measures.\n\nIt reminds me of those games of yesterday and I have to say I enjoy it's simplicity and fun combat. A good pick up and play for an hour or two at a time.

Ys is a very good game, with lots of action and decent difficulty. I found it hard during the first half, but mostly because my character didn't have a lvel high enough for the bosses. This forced me to grind more, which made the final part of the game very easy.

In my opinion, this is the best Ys title currently available on Steam/PC.

If you've played other Ys games, you know what to expect. Compared to the other titles, Origin is reasonably short (roughly 6 hours) but has 3 playable characters. Playing the game with all three characters does add a significant amount of replay value, as they play completely differently, and also have some unique story elements. Once you're done with the three main campaigns, there's also an arena mode for an extra challenge.

As usual, the soundtrack is fantastic, and the controls are spot on.

This game turned out to be a real diamond in the rough for me.
Bought it years ago cheap in some sale. And thought i would play it just because it's in my library.
Turned out this game is awesome!

It's an action RPG, hack 'n' slash style. Combat is very fluid and responsive and more importantly fun.
The story in the game is also very good, although it develops along slowly, so it wont rope you in that fast. But once it gets it's hooks in you it's too late. This is the first Ys game i bought and after completing it i had to buy Ys I & II Chronicles+, i want to know how the story continues, and i will get the other games aswell.

The game is unique in that you have to play the game through 3 times to get the full story. There are 3 characters to play. Yunica, Hugo and Toal. Toal can only be played after you have completed the game with Yunica and Hugo, and rightfuly so as Toals playthrough contains the most story with couple plot twists even.

This game also has a very high replayability. It wont get boring to play through it several times. And after you beat the game there is also time attack mode, boss rush and arena where you can compete for leaderboards. In arena you also get points you can use in a bonus shop to buy alternative characters to play through the story with.

Big time bang for your buck!

On story page it says this game has partial controller support. I played through it with controller, also tried keyboard both works fine, i just liked controler better. Even if all tutorial popups show keyboard keybinds.

No items to use, no breaths to catch in intense fights, using only your wits, reactions, and skills, this is game can be pretty tough but it's a blessing to those to loves a challenge. It's a short yet classic JRPG game with some nice anime touch to it. The gameplay is nice, exploration is simple to a certain degree. The real deal is dealing with some bosses. Though not mandatory, it is reccommended to take your time exploring EVERYWHERE to make your life slightly easier.\nThis, I should say, was worth the money spent. Reccommendation Approved

after playing 3 hours:
- awesome soundtrack (it's Falcom after all, and that eargasmic opening (´ ∀ ` ))
- fast combat which sometimes reminds of bullet hell games and totally awesome boss battles
only the menu interface looks a little bad
graphics are quite good (this game is from 2006),runs smooth and works perfect with controller.

I finished Hugo's story in 13 hours which is even more than I expected and I must say this game is a masterpiece. It has the best soundtrack I've ever heard in game. Story is awesome. Graphics simple but beautiful.
sadly it lacks some RPG elements - no crafting, only a few armor sets that are found while progressing the story, only 3 special skills, no healing items only herbs dropping from monsters - I'm comparing here to Ys Seven which has these elements.
It's still an awesome game and personally I give it 10/10 and I have still 2 characters to complete story \(゜∀ ゜)/

My personal favourite game in the Ys series, The game isn't that long, or that hard for that matter on both hard and medium, it didn't feel like the Ys i've came to love (that sir is why you grow some balls and play it nightmare).

To start with you got two characters, Axe weilding female and a eye ball wielding wizard.

Now the wizard is pretty easy to use .. too easy, makes half the bosses a joke and is a safe choice if thi is your first venture (His EX form is pretty coolio though)
The Warrior is how orgin (in my opinion) should be played, bosses suddenly become a challenge  and the game becomes hella fun. (Her EX form is pretty nuts too)

There is a third and fourth character, Mr. X is <spoiler city>  and crazy hard to play as and is required to unlock the true final boss (who needs to go die in a hole) while the fourth character you unlock through arena which are the main guys from previous Ys games.

The story could be considered weak in some aspects.

iamoutofwordsdarn
Super underrated, absolutely great game,

I've got to say i'm totally fallen in love with this game. Yeah the graphic might not be that good but it doesn't matter anyway, the combat feels so smooth and not to mention awesome BGM provided. Simply amazing game.
This game is awesome, buy it!

Beautiful JRPG. The characters and plot are interesting and engaging. The combat is subtly complex, and separates good gameplay from great gameplay. Beating the game with different main characters who have unique fighting styles and stories provides excellent replay-ability. Many levels of difficulty for those who want more or less challenge. Very solid game.

It's the game Falcom made after Oath in Felghana. The combat system is even more polished, the boss battles even more crazy, the music even more fantastic (in places), and the player characters even more talkactive. While it lacks an overworld it doesn't skimp on providing an interesting and varied labyrinth to go through.\nIf you haven't bought Oath in Felghana yet, you should. If you haven't, you'll find what I wrote above (in parts) easy to believe! Origin improves on the amazing gameplay of its predecessor, while adding more to be awed at! And it's a real PC exclusive game!\nAs before, though, might be too hardcore for some. Graphics were good for their time, but aren't spectacular now. You don't need to care about the story.
If you enjoy RPG's This is a MUST PLAY!

An all-around great RPG. Extremely well-designed in every category. Feels like playing one of those old-school, memorable, classic games. Three characters (one unlockable) with different fighting styles and their own take on the same story. Much easier than the previous games in the series (it's a good thing.) I really enjoyed this game and have no complaints with it.

This game is an isometric Devil May Cry.  It is absolutely ♥♥♥♥ing crazy.  The Sprites on Polygons artstyle is the only complaint I have, other than a more or less standard story.  Even then, the story's shaping up to be better than a lot of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t in other games, and the art is pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ed well done.  It is delightfully paced, it is action ♥♥♥♥ing packed and it will make sweet, sweet love to your ♥♥♥ with its excellent soundtrack, intense bosses and crazy ♥♥♥♥ it allows you to do.

Live the legend that is Ys in Ys: Origin. Search through a sprawling and multi tiered tower that you may remember from other Ys games for the first time on a quest to find the twin goddesses and thwart demons and outsiders alike. While easier and much more linear than others in the series, this game provides multiple characters with different playstyles and controls the same as modern Ys installments for fast and decisive action. A gloriously atmospheric and rocking soundtrack supports the different zones of the tower while monsterous and menacing bosses bar your path to your ultimate goal of rescuing the goddesses.

The various ways to complete this game depending on what character you pick through their combat style makes this game very replayable if you are a fan of Ys or real-time action RPGs. Through the use of magic artifacts and different weapons you are able to find unique weaknesses in enemies and exploit them viciously. While your equipment is very limited for a Ys game, the items you can pick up are mostly the ones you know and love from other installments as they are recovered from the broken land of Ys here initially.

I never had a Ys game before Oath, but with this, I and II (remade with the old bump" combat style)
date: and Oath as well in my library I always keep coming back to Ys for another adventure."

reviewText: At this point you practically owe it to yourself if you're an Ys/Action RPG fan to throw as much money at Falcom and XSeed so we can get more good stuff from them.  It goes without saying that Origin is a terrific game, and these guys should get all the support they deserve.

A really excellent game which you fight your way through hordes of demons to reach the top of a tower filled with dark energy. Sure you do the same thing in Persona 3 but Ys: Origin does it's story so well that you don't ever need to leave the tower. And with 3 distinct characters and a group of NPCs really make for a rich story.With challenging bosses and diverse environments, and various difficulty levels make this game easy to pick up and play a few on the fly.\n\nEven without Adol the Red as a character you've got an authentic true to the series feeling game. Time and money well spent.
My favorite series in the universe.
All this game needs is a button to skip the unending stream of boring pointless dialogue and it would be perfect.

The ones that would appreciate this game the most are fan of Ys because it’s a prequel for the first Ys games. But that doesn’t mean this can’t be enjoyed by newcomers. It has that classic SNES adventure feel but will enhanced graphics like all other Ys games. There are multiple characters you can play in story mode but replaying story mode for minor changes in dialogue and events for the first two characters was tedious. The main replay-ability is in arena and boss mode. Overall the sprite animation is an improvement over Ys: The Oath in Felghana and most replay focus is on extras. It’s worth picking up for what it is and if you are already a fan of the Ys franchise you’ll enjoy the lore.
I've played one of the Y's on my psp long ago it was so fantastic i had to get this one; Great game 15/10 :)
It's awesome!!!!
This game is a must for old school action jrpg fans.

Pros: Really great selection of tools with uses in combat and in puzzles, varied and interesting enemy designs, superb boss fights, very energetic soundtrack.

Cons: Poor feedback when hit (there's no sound effect, just a red number that pops up that I missed a few times,) Bosses have VERY deep health pools when compared to how easily some enemies will fall so a certain degree of grinding may be necessary, and you can't pause the game when fighting a boss (I think this is to prevent players from teleporting out of the room to avoid a loss or something, but I should still be able to pause the game.)

Even with those issues I still had a great time. Strongly recommended.
Not a very long or epic story, game takes place in a single tower, but is a fun action RPG.  Lots of replay value to unlock everything.  Great play for any RPG fan.

This is the prequel to a classic series.\nA must to all RPG/Action fan out there, there is full of replayabilities as you can play through the game with three completely different characters. A playthough can take to 15-20 hours to complete, with 3 characters you can go to 60 hours and you have different difficulties to go with if you want it to be more challenging.\nThere is also the boss rush mode that unlocked when you finish the game where you must take on all the bosses of the game without pause or healing, really nice mode.
Amazing, fun and challenging game! Just remember to upgrade your items, or you're going to have a bad/hard time.

An excellent action-RPG that can be a bit difficult to control while fighting, especially when fighting flying targets.  I honestly recommend playing this before Ys I, because even though it spoils an Ys I plot twist by its mere premise, it's a great way to learn about the world of Ys, and once you're done, you'll be ready to journey with Adol, where you'll remember important names and places, but you can see how much the world has changed in the 700 years since.
An amazing Metroidvania-style RPG with multiple characters and styles of play, beautiful graphics and artwork, and most of all, an engaging story and narrative.
B-E-A-Utiful!

Fast-paced Metroidvania beat-em-up dungeon crawler. Works great with a gamepad. Graphics are PS2-era but more than suffice, especially with the settings maxed. The MUSIC. Oh, the music. Most of the dungeon tunes are technical speed metal obviously performed entirely on synths. Nonetheless it fits perfectly.\n\nAnd that's the thing with Ys Origin. All of the pieces come together and make a surprisingly excellent package. Highly Recommended!!

Ys Origin is an Japanese-style action RPG, set as a prequel to the Ys series. This is the first Ys game I've played, and I've definitely been enjoying it.

The game's combat system is the best part of it: normal enemies don't give you much of a challenge because they're easily stun-locked (as Yunica, at least), but the boss battles are intense. The bosses are difficult and they take a while to bring down even if you know what you're doing, but their attacks are easily predicted. It does take some skill to get through it, though (on Normal). The game's story and world are also interesting; it has one of the better game stories I've seen recently.

This game is definitely worth considering for any RPG fan, and I would recommend it even at full price to fans of the genre.
not as polished as ys oath, but still pretty good. also has multiple characters i guess

Hack-n-slash game with RPG elements that offers enough challenge to keep gameplay interesting from start to finish.  Overall, it's a really solid title across the board, with the main highlights being the level design, boss fights, and soundtrack. As modern Ys games go, this is probably the best.\n\nAs the name implies, this is a origin story that chronologically takes place before the rest of the games in the Ys series.  Ys Origin has three different playable characters, and each character has a distinct gameplay style and story path.

Although not quite as amazing as YS: Oath in Felghana, this is still an amazing game.  It has all the great action you'd expect, three characters that play differently, and a decent story.  The linearity of the design and toned-down difficulty (if you've beaten Oath on normal or above, you'll probably want to start with Hard here) are slightly disappointing, but overall I still enjoyed the many hours I spent playing this and highly recommend it.

A great game for any jrpg lovers. You can have 3 different perspectives of the story with the 3 characters you can play and each story takes ~9hrs. Gameplay is mostly button mashing with some strategy. If you want to be a badass there are 2 higher difficulty settings. The graphics are a nice mix of 3D/2D and the soundtrack was never boring. If your a lore nerd Ys happens to be a long series, with games on the PS3, Vita, Ds...etc and anime.
Classy and Sassy clash in an awesome game. In harder difficulty's missing any mechanics really bones you. Game is very fun and challgening good buy

This game is AWESOME!! it's a fast paced skilled shooter RPG. This game can be pretty Intense. And the grapics are amazing, especally on how old this game is, And the music rocks!, A lill bit of japanese metal in there which makes it more epic. I would deffinitely recommend this game to any anime fan out there. The only drawback about this game is i  wish it had  CO-OP it would be awesome to play with a friend. Two Thumbs up for this game!!

Ys: Origin is a nice chunk of game, and a fun little action RPG.  There's a lot to discover, and your character becomes very powerful as you go along.  I spent just about 17 hours on it but still was able to build my character up to Level 50.  The game is challenging on Normal difficulty, but I only felt that a couple of boss fights were somewhat unfair.  Goddess statues grant you further augmentation of your powers and armor.  Exploration is rewarded; if you're diligent, you'll find everything.  Highly recommended.

It's a pretty decent hack'n'slash ARPG, if that's all you're looking for, but it doesn't particularly stand out unless you're there for the Ys part of it. The combat is solid but doesn't have a ton of depth. The characters are likable but don't have a ton of depth. The story is your standard bad guys did something bad; now the good guys better do something about it" fare
date: so it won't carry anything on its own (not to mention it only shows up for a few minutes of exposition every hour or so). It would be a fairly satisfying little timekiller that doesn't really stand out in any way except for one thing: a lot of the unlocks feel like they're on a free-to-play schedule in a non-free-to-play game.\n\nThe higher tier upgrades in the story mode take an absurd amount of grinding to pay for. Can't beat a boss? Grind some levels
recommended: because a single level's worth of stats will make an enormous difference in the damage you deal/take. Two levels will change a fight from brutally hard to a pushover (although that's more "return of the 90s" than "when free-to-play games attack"). There are a bunch of bonus game modes you can unlock and extra characters and alternate character versions with different attacks and all sorts of stuff like that
hoursPlayed: but they require beating the entire story mode so many times (and weirdly
voteText: most of the achievement requirements are also "beat the game multiple times") that I'm guessing at least 90% of people will never even see things like arena mode. I know I certainly won't
helpfulPercent: even though I'd try it out if it were available immediately after having beaten the game the first time. It makes Korean MMOs look like they're concerned that you don't get outside enough.\n\nAside from that
votesTotal: but I'd mostly only recommend it to people who want more backstory to the Ys games."

reviewText: Ys Origin is just what it sounds like the Origin of the Ys Series. The Ys Series is one of the best action rpg of all time. If you love Action Rpgs Why don't you have this yet.

I think they made this game entirely so they could remake the Ys I & II bosses with the superlative Ys VI engine. Not that I mind! Though I don't know why they chose to make a game based on the worst thing about Ys I (stuck in the tower for half the game, now you're stuck in the tower for the whole game!) But it's good because the Ys VI mechanics are a work of action game art.
Hack and slash console game.  What is there not to like?  If you liked any of the previous Ys series, this will hit those same buttons for you.
God damnit, this game makes me happy.\n\nIf you've ever played Secret of Mana"
date: the Japan-only released "Seiken Densetsu 3" or even Supergiantgames' "Bastion"
recommended: you pretty much know what to expect from Ys Origin. This is old-school
hoursPlayed: balls-to-the-walls hack'n'slay action and it is glorious.\n\nCombat feels smoth and responsive (as long as you avoid playing as Hugo)
voteText: the story is cheesy and fun without getting too silly or taking you out of your comfort-zone. You also don't really need to play any previous games to understand what the hell is going on

reviewText:
Nightmare mode is hard.

Really hard.
You wish you were playing on normal.
You will need a new save file for that.

8/10, pretty good.

Extremely excellent ARPG - Xseed did a great job on localizing this game. This is my first Ys game and so far I'm hooked and have purchased the other ones. Origin seems like a great place to start. Music is awesome too!

This game is awesome all around. Some of the best music I've heard.
Neoclassical arpeggios and harpsichord interludes help intensify the experience as a whole.
Brings me back to the good 'ol days of 16-32bit gaming-Japanese-style baby!
If you are a devote fan of classic JRPG's with action based combat. Look no further.
Do yourselves a favour: Buy it. Support old"school gaming. :)"

This game is all about the bosses, and most of them are pretty entertaining to fight and are challenging as well. I also really like the artstyle, usually sprites + 3D doesn't look so good but it looks nice here. The game is polished, crisp, and controller friendly, definitely worth a try.

Delightfully old-school action-RPG. Isometric view, 2D sprites on a 3D background, and fast-paced button-mashing combat. It can be rather challenging on the higher difficulties, where bosses both massive and man-sized will repeatedly deliver you a taste of the afterlife. The story drives the action nicely and sets up for the events of Ys I&II, but it's not the most memorable tale ever told. The real soul of Ys Origin is in smashing 50-foot bosses using your trusty adolescent girl with a giant axe and conveniently-placed magical artifacts. With 3 playable characters (and you'll probably want to play through the game with each) and a more than ten-hour campaign, Ys Origin gives you a lot of bang for your buck. Or, rather, a lot of slash, smash, and pew-pew for your buck.
Good game over all. Boss fights are amazing.
Um RPG de ação clássico e atemporal.
It's fun to play.

Great graphics, great old-school gameplay, great adventure metal soundtrack, great backstory for Ys I&II.  The option to play as one of three characters, each of whom have a different story and a completely different playstyle, is pretty neat.  Fun and highly recommended to people who like this sort of thing, but I've got one complaint:  no matter which character you choose, you have to go through the same huge tower and fight the same monsters (for the most part).  I wish Origin would have had a different scenario for each character or a shorter shared campaign.
If you're a fan of Action RPG's, I highly recommend this game.

Entertaining gameplay
Really strong narrative
Damn good music for its time
Challenging game that can last like 20hours+
...Um there are a few noticeable problems holding it back so it  Won't astound everyone, but IT IS worth your time and cash
Enjoyed this quite a bit.  Y's move to 3D was the best thing that could have happened to it, and this game continues it's tradition of being extremely fun.
Less boring than Final Fantasy.
Is it an RPG?  Is it a shooter?  I don't care; It's amazingly fun!
If you want a challenge and can get past all the weeaboo ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.
Excellent storyline and characters, plus a pleasing setting and decent character models. Overall a good game that I would recommend to anyone who favors J-Indie games or the hack and slash genre.

advantages: best of best game in the YS series, best 2.5D Japanese APRG ever!\ndisadvantages: CG need to be remaked. Steam Achievements are funny, but hard to achieve them all. No option to use the original Japanese language.\ntips: DON'T USE KEYBOARD, BUY A GAMEPAD. WITHOUT A GAMEPAD, YOU CANNOT ENJOY THE GAME 100%

Definitely love this game. Even though this game is straightforward, like no visiting towns, caves or things like that. The entire game takes place in a Tower. I love playing as Toal Fact (Hugo Fact's older brother). He has a few comical encounters with one of the Darklings named Epona regarding Hugo. LOL Definitely recommend this game. Has alot of replay value. :)

A decent Jrpgs, just like any other Ys in the series. 3 different characters to choose from and ♥♥♥♥. Meh, it's YS. Just a good old hack and slash jrpg. good enough to me, I enjoyed it.\n\nOverall: 7.5/10
BEAUTIFUL! the only way to describe tis game is beautiful. Grab ur usb gamepad and buy this game now. Any RPG fan will enjoy this title.
A part of the best Action RPG series you've (probably) never played. So play it!

Amazing soundtrack, very good plataform game with unique battle system, game reminds Legend of Zelda in terms of powerups. Very action oriented game and Bosses that will make you think a little instead of hack'n'slashing him non stop.
Did I mentioned that the game have a amazing soundtrack? The game have a amazing soundtrack.
Game is the beginning of the series hence the name Origin, so if you plan in get into the series here is a good start.
<3~

More Ys love.
Wish Adol was a girl instead?  Covered.
Want to be a mage instead of a melee master?  Covered.
Want to play one of the bad guys?  Covered.
Another episode in the series that does not disappoint.

I never realised how much fun this game could be! It combines RPG with platforming and hack and slash style gameplay to form this truly amazing yet simple game to life!\n\nIntruder gives his trespassing seal of approval!
A truly amazing series. Easily one of the best I've ever played.

If you still have a wet nurse, this game is not for you. If you still need a baby sitter when your parent(s) aren't home, this game is not for you. If you like games like (Insert pretty much any recent AAA title here) and the hand holding that goes with it, this game is not for you.\n\n...But... If you love a challenge, if you love frantic, yet still skill based gameplay that rewards talent, and punishes mashing, and if you love bosses that EARN the right to be referred to as a boss, then YOU. WILL. LOVE. THIS. GAME.

I really like the old school feel of this title.  the controls are simple and there isn't alot of menu or inventory management, just some good old real time RPG monster bashing.  plenty of bonuses for speed too.

This is a fun old school style RPG game with a very Japanese feel. The story is kind of typical for this type of game and there is a lot of dialogue as usual, but the graphics are very nice, if simple, and the controls are good. Bosses aren't easy and the fighting can get monotonous after awhile, but I enjoyed this game nonetheless. Don't know if it's worth $20 but I recommend picking it up is it's on sale.
Fast, action packed combat; challenging bosses. Three playable characters each with their own storyline. Great game.
Very fun! Has a bunch of replayability due to having 2 characters to choose from in the beginning and one unlocked at the end of the game. Seriously liking these Ys remakes a lot!
Awesome action RPG !
Play Ys I & II first. Really.\n\nOtherwise this is a wonderful title.

Ys Orgins is a high speed twitch action rpg that starts the Ys series rolling. This is a never version of Orgins as Ys has seen many newer version of several of their titles. I highly enjoyed the storyline as well as the combat, anyone a fan of action rpg's woth many differnet play through outcomes should take a look at this. I give Ys orgins a 8/10 a great start to an even bigger story to come.

A game that test reflexes and skill in a Action RPG that deem quality in the content of boss fights. This game will destroy you in every way but will make you always come back for more. Text only to explain this game would never do it justice. Watch some videos and give it a shot. This game will blow you away.

A dungeon climbing, action RPG, so it already fits my current desired mold.  The story is kinda dumb since it anime fluff, but the music and gameplay more than make up for it.  The structure of the game is remiscent of a Zelda game but with far less adventuring and item usage.  While satisfying to play, the worst parts of the game to me have to be the half-baked platforming and the unskippable cutscenes.
The excellent action, gameplay mechanics, music and atmosphere of Oath in Felghana + dungeon-crawler gameplay.  Fantastic.
If you l;ove old school action JRPGs like Zelda or Secret of Mana, you can't get much better than this.  The controls, music and over all game play is top notch.
played he demo for 10 min. fell instantly in love with it. today one of my fav games of all times!\nwortth every f*ing cent!

Great everything, just buy it. Multiply that by 3, because there's 3 characters, each with a different story path. You will definitly get more than what you paid for.\n\nPS: If you do end up buying Ys Chronicles too, I'd suggest to play Chronicles before Origin, because I & II have a battle system very different from Origin, and after playing Origin, you might not want to play or enjoy I & II as much, though story-wise, it would be Origin followed by I & II.

THE GOOD: The music, the story, the gameplay.

THE BAD: I can see the game being a bit grind heavy for some.

THE BOTTOM LINE: If you like JRPGs and have never checked out the Ys series, this is the best possible starting point. If you like what you see, you'll like the games as a whole. Definitely wish I discovered this series earlier in my life.
Awesome action RPG !
Play Ys I & II first. Really.\n\nOtherwise this is a wonderful title.

A great Action RPG from beginning to end!

Ys Origin is a JRPG but much more focused on the Action genre. So even if your equipments and levels are important, player's skill is highly rewarded as well.

I played as Yunica on Normal difficulty and based on that I loved this game! The challenge is good but rarely too difficult that you can't defeat a particular boss, which all are creative and fun to fight against.

There isn't much customization as this is somewhat of a dungeon crawler, as you battle your way to the top a of tower but there's plenty of story to see and characters to meet on your way.

One particular point I feel I must mention before ending this short review is how awesome the music is. I have played tons of RPGs over the years, be they Japanese or Western and the music in this game easily is among the top!

So in all, I highly recommend this game to RPG fans in general. If you want a nice story, excellent music or an engaging combat, this game got you covered!

Ys Origin is an awesome game with gorgeous 2.5-D animation, an animation style that is severely under represented, and fast fluid gameplay. Ys Origin action plays at breakneck speed with each of the 3 characters providing a unique aspect of the overal story and each playing style varing greatly. It is like getting 3 full games for the price of one!

Ys Origin plays has nice style and is great fun.  I only wish there were more games like this on Steam especially considering the extensive Ys catalog, yet only 3 titles are offered. With that said Ys Origin is among the best and shouldn’t be missed!

Highly recommended!

This game is just... wow ! Graphisms and artwork are great, the ost is good (some music like the boss theme for exemple are epic !), the storyline... well he's average for Yunica and Hugo but a bit more interesting for the secret character we can play once we finish the game for the first time (That tempts to play, doesn't it ?). As usual, there are 5 difficulty modes (Very easy until nightmare) and I find this opus a little easier than The Oath in Felghana". The game (only 1 storyline) in "normal" difficulty ends in 12-13 hours but if you want to do the game at 100%
date: Ys Origin will occupy you approximately 50-60 hours. He's not expensive
hoursPlayed: October 27, 2012

reviewText: This game really brigs me back to the SNES days of action RPGs. It has great, smooth gameplay, fantastic replayability, and a decent story. I've yet to play others in the series, but this game was a blast and a challenge!

Kinda old school RPG. Kinda platformer. There were some pretty fun boss fights. The only thing that bugged me was that you could just fail some fights horribly, then go grind a couple levels and have it be too easy.
If you like the Final Fantasy series, Ragnarok Online and the platformer hack & slash games...you will probably love this one too.
A really awesome game with tons of action and quite a bit of unlockables.

Surprisingly fun action hack and slash zelda / bastion style game.  Easy levels but ridiculously hard boss fights, though ones that feel satisfying once you finally figure them out.  Anime style story with typical tropes for main characters (innocent idealist fighter and snobby cocky mage), though despite this has an interesting story that changes enough to warrant multiple playthroughs on other characters.

Grindy, storyless, extremely simple combat, single dungeon RPG. If you're looking for an RPG with a focus on boss battles that doesn't take 50 hours to run though, this a good choice. There's a bit of exploration but the goal is always clear: up. You can breeze through the game up until the bosses, at which point you have to spend some time grinding up to the proper level. No real loot, combat tactics, overworld, shops, or side quests to worry about. It's a real shut off your brain game, which is why I come to Ys.

Ys Origins is the very first of the series (in Ys timeline, not by release date) and sets the stage for the rest of the games.

The gameplay is somewhat like the Legend of Zelda/Alundra (for those who had played this game back in the era of the PS1) with the addition of a basic leveling system.

The story plays out over the course of 2 character, in which you choose to play through one of those character's storyline and after finishing, can go back and play the other (as well as the 3rd character after you complete the game with one of the first two playable characters). It is recommened that you play the female character first, then the male, then the third character as their storyline is a cannon to the main" characters of the game.

This game is also very grindy and the story is bland
date: but an overall fun game as long as you don't mind the mindnumbing end game grand.\n\nI picked this up on sale for roughly $5 USD and would recommend it at this price
recommended: but not at it's full price. I only wish Steam had more JRPGs than what is currently offered."

reviewText: Ys Bosses are where its at, the Ys Arrange remix of Scars of the Divine Wings" is epic"

Three storylines to follow.  Fast, optional combat.  Bosses that are hard as the Devil's nipples.  Stop reading this and throw your money at XSeed and Falcom for this already!  GO PLAY THIS GAME NOW KAY

Ys Origin is a great example of a fun 'Action JRPG'. I missed out on the Ys series years ago, but always heard great things about it. These types of games are not always common on PC, so it was a plesant surprise to be able to play one of such calibre! There are also several characters, allowing multiple playthroughs as well. If you enjoyed JRPG's back in the 1990's, but don't have the time to play them now, this is the game for you. Deep, enjoyable, but not too long. I have now bought Ys I & II for some real JRPG action!

Game is brilliant

*BUT*

The longest unskippable title movie/intro I have EVER experienced. Then once you've watched one title scene, you're onto another. Then an intro dialogue. Then an intro back and fourth. Then a bit of anime. Takes. For. Ever.

Hashtag, Painful KillMeNow

If you're looking for a fun, challenging action RPG, look no further than Ys Origin.\n\nYs Origin delivers a solid game with three protagonists to choose from—each with their own play style and storylines to follow as they march into the Devil's Tower to chase after the twin Goddesses of Ys. The action is nonstop as players ascend upwards, fighting hordes of demons and unique boss battles along the way—all the while accompanied by an amazing soundtrack.

Ys origin is a 2-D action RPG. Choosing one of three playable characters your lot is cast to save two goddesses from a tower filled with demons. For how bland that original set up sounds a solid cast of characters, challenging boss fights, and a pretty darn good sound track round out an enjoyable experience.

Very good purchase. Still not done, but the story has pulled me in, has good graphics, good gameplay, skills and equipment are very easy to manage, and the game actually has put a good weight on the difficulties. You can expect to die above normal if you haven't already played through it, which is okay cause you rarely lose progress.

For the Americans playing:

The game is called Ys. not Y's.
Ys, pronounced 'eece'.


Excellent game. Love Hugo. He's a smartass, but overpowered when it comes to the Eyes of Fact. Finding out the Claw's identity is cool as well.

The description for this game does NOT do it justice. The gameplay falls somewhere between Castlevania and Gauntlet. There are a ton of enemy types that each have a weakness for one of three weapons and the abilities that go with them. Infinitely refilling magic capabilities give you an edge against the onslaught. But most importantly, this is a game that rewards risk. That faster and more efficiently you defeat foes, the faster you level, going up to 2x speed. Oh, and the bosses? Classic gaming style oozes from them as you learn patterns and find the weakspots. I bought this blind and couldn't be happier. I haven't had this much fun with a game in a long, long time. BUY IT ALREADY.
really fun game but its extremely hard prepare to rage a bit
complete this for some retro fun\ncomplete this on nightmare for self acknowledgement\ncomplete this and all of its content for some masochistic gratificaton

Picked it up never playing a Ys game before.  Pleasantly surprised at how much fun it is.  It can be frustrating sometimes when the enemies attack en masse and you cant  help but be hit by their stronger attacks, but I'm assuming that's part of the learning curve.

Don't spend your time watching screenshots of this game. Check out the demo, fall in love and download it ASAP. Ys Origins does have what I really want from a game; awesome gameplay and one of the best soundtracks I've ever heard. What else do you want?

Ys Origin is an ARPG similar to games like Legend of Mana or Legacy of Goku. The game tells the story of two children(?) whom are traveling with their people to find their deities that seem to have gotten captured. You pick one of the two characters, each offering a unique" story but ultimately the same main points are hit the same and you play through the exact same levels. What keeps this fresh is that the two characters offer a completely different play style
date: one is like a tank the other a mage (there's also a third one who plays like a berserker) so there's a little replayability. The stories are mildly interesting nothing ground breaking
recommended: it's pretty much every jrpg ever so you climb the tower
hoursPlayed: find bad guys
voteText: things aren't what they seem to be

votesHelpful: many may like it far more than me but after playing games like The Walking Dead and Ni no Kuni it seems lacking in comparision.\nI reccomend this game to any ARPG lovers or JRPG fans in general.\n8/10"

reviewText: I've played one of the Y's on my psp long ago it was so fantastic i had to get this one; Great game 15/10 :)

As of this review, I have played through to nearly the second boss of the game. I'm not one for being long-winded (most of the time) so I will just put up the scores and my reasoning for them.

Story: 8/10. It's a little bland for a game where you go searching for your twin goddesses, but it's enough where you feel motivated to stay alive long enough to follow through on your task.

Control: 6/10. When you first get to control your character, you're thrown directly into combat with a group of four enemies with just a short-winded instruction panel. The controls feel clunky at first, but any fan of Diablo should be able to quickly adjust.

Gameplay: 7/10. It's an action RPG, aka a hack and slash. What did you expect?

Graphics: 9/10. Even on the lowest settings (and it works AMAZINGLY on low-end computers, just saying that here!) it looks rather pretty. For a six-year-old game, it's held up rather well.

Overall: 7.5/10. Go get this game- you won't be sorry.
AWSOME HACK N SLASH ACTION RPG IMO ...PUZZLES...CHALLENGING BOSS BATTLES...AWSOME MUSIC....GREAt gameplay good ...story line

This is a good game. The combat is simple but fun. There's a few different characters to play through as. The story is simple but nice. If you've played the other Ys games (mainly Ys I & II), there are some cute references to them here, but playing them is not required to understand the story and enjoy the game.\n\nAlso, this game has a great soundtrack.

Awesome Action RPG game. It's a challenging game with different mechanincs, story (and enemies) for each character, making the experience with each other unique. The combat is challenging (specially for bosses) even in the easiest game difficulties, and does not becomes boring with time due. The story is not so deep, but is not bad, but it's quite linear, the only extras available are out of the main game. The soundtrack is amazing that sometimes you will be willing to spend time on a place just to hear its BGM.

It's a really fun hack-and-slash with a rockin' soundtrack and epic boss fights. Fair warning: You must play through the game at least two times (finish with one of two characters which unlocks the third character) to get the true ending that wraps up the story of the game and makes it the prequel to the rest of the Ys series that it is.
It's a Japanese action RPG, so expect grinds if you want to progress, but don't let that discourage you.  This game is fun fun fun.

Uh, this game is amazing.  It's sorta like an older Zelda game, though much more action paced.  You can play as multiple characters (which don't feel the same at all) and at multiple difficulty levels.

High replayability and lots of extra modes make this one you won't put down for a while.

If you don't already own this game, you really should.  BUY IT!
play dis if ya gotta big ♥♥♥♥

I bought this game in a steam sale not knowing much of what to expect... i was blown away - this is probably one of the most fun basic action jrpg style games i've ever had the joy of wasting life on.

The combat is really fun for the most part and the bosses, while a step up in difficulty, are quite fun.  The game has a very Old School RPG feel.  There are multiple storylines to play through and depending on the difficulty each one takes some time to complete.  This game is well worth the money.  I've never played a Ys game before this and this is quite a good start.  My only dislike about the game is the lack of customization.  Yes, battles are fun.  Yes, the story is interesting.  But, there is no cusomization option.  There are no side-grades only upgrades, so you really just wait to see what you find next to powerup.  Other than that though I do enjoy it.

This is a fine game. You'd do good to purchase it. It's got really fast and challenging combat, bosses that feel REALLY rewarding to finally defeat, and tons of replay value due to including three characters and five difficulties for the game, as well as secrets. The soundtrack to this game is also rather well done. The only thing that could be improved would be the graphics, but they serve their purpose well without cluttering the screen, and who cares about graphics if the gameplay is awesome! If you like any other ARPGs, you owe it to yourself to get this at some point.

Such a great game, you can play as three different characters with different storylines that give you bits and pieces of what happened before YsI&II and why the Goddesses left Ys with the black pearl.

I recommend this game along with Oath in Felgana and I&II.

And here's hoping XSeed also brings Eiyuu Densetsu (Sora, Zero and Ao) games for the PC as well.

It's got the hacking and the slashing and the anime and the top down and the graphics and the dungeons and the crawling and the different characters and the spells and the controller suport and I like it a lot.

Fans of the Ys Series, rejoice in learning the origin of the legends which the first two games are based off of. The game primarily revolves around either Yunica Tovah or Hugo Fact, and yes, those family names should be familiar to those who've played the first two games. Each of them plays differently, with some mechanics making some fights a lot easier than others, some more difficult.

This game serves as the seventh canonical entry in the Ys series (Ys V is non-canon), and as a prequel to the entire series. It does a lot to explain a lot of the lore in the first two games, as well as why even in the main series, there is always a seemingly world ending threat around the corner.

The game has three characters, two of which are available from the start: Yunica Tovah and Hugo Fact. The third is unlockable after beating the game with either one and finishes the story with its true ending. Even if you don't beat it with him, there is still a lot that is canon from Yunica and Hugo's endings, just not the true mastermind, a very familiar enemy who was responsible for the events in Ys I & II.

Killing normal enemies is rather easy, and if you are having trouble, go back to a previous zone and grind a couple of levels, then come back. You will easily know when you've grinded enough in a zone when the experience rewards vs. the amount needed to level becomes more grindy than the time needed is worth. Basically, if you need to level, you can gain   a level in about 10 - 15 minutes, sooner if you're on the low side for the zone.

Still, the main focus is the bosses. Each has unique mechanics and weaknesses that you need to take into account. Don't be surprised if you die a few times figuring out the boss, and if your attention slips, or you make a wrong move, then you are in for a world of hurt. That's where the fun is.

Having played the rather sub-par Ys games on the SNES, I honestly wasn't expecting much from this game. I was pleasantly surprised to find a fun, hack-n-slash action RPG that does really well in capturing a retro feel. Boss fights are fun and challenging. The exploration aspect of the game is very stripped-down, but being that it's weighted more towards being an action game than a super in-depth RPG, that's fine.

A fun and fast-paced action JRPG similar to Castlevania. You gain very temporary stat boosts every time you kill an enemy so it rewards you for playing at breakneck speed which is very satisfying.

The overall plot is a bit generic but the dialogue itself is absolutely fantastic. The exchanges between the characters feels very natural and interesting. It is also free of the unintentional awkward moments that JRPGs tend to have due to sloppy translations.

The game is of about medium length for an action game, about 10-15 hours on hard mode. However  you are able to play through multiple times as different characters to get a different perspective on the story and each has a unique style of fighting.

The graphics are a little dated and look like they belong on the Playstation 2 but that's a minor fault.

Lastly, the game is clearly designed to be played on a gamepad. You can play with the keyboard and mouse but it's sort of clumsy.

I've never played any Ys game before, but I'm thoroughly enjoying my playthrough so far. Only about 6 floors in so I have no idea howmuch there is left and I'm repeatedly getting my rear handed to me on nightmare mode first playthrough. I have to say this is one of the few games where constant death doesn't bother me as it generally feels like I made a mistake.

So far the enemies have been scaling really well in all of their drops, and anytime I get stuck on a boss (so far both I've run into one) I don't mind going back and grinding a level or two to beef up my stats and try again and feel a noticeable difference. Leveling feels really solid so far as I feel a discernible, if not momentous, difference each time I gain a level, and makes me feel rewarded for hard work.

The controls feel pretty tight with the combat and platforming working very well to challenge your mastery of the game's mechanics. I can't say I've blamed hitboxes or funky camera angles so far whenever I fail to make a jump or whatnot, and that's a solid plus in my book.

Want a challenging game that could very well dunk you on the first practice fight? (Yea that happened, and it felt great). Do you enjoy platforming? Do you like feeling rewarded every time you grind up a level or want upgrades that make you think about a purchase? This game is probably for you.

I want this game to be the first I reccomend because it deserves no less. Ys Origin has it all: adjustable challenge through many different difficulty levels, many different gaming modes, extremely high replay value through the stories of the three main characters, which should be played in this order: Yunica, Hugo and the third char, each one with a more surprising and amazing story than the previous one, reaching the peak with the third char's story, the canon one, that both blows and completes the other two's stories at the same time. Enjoy the perfect atmosphere that this game has to offer, exploring a dangerous tower while interacting with allies and enemies, making your way towards the surprising ending. So, suck that, Castlevania X; the RPG-platform genre has a new king. To whoever reads this: don't miss this game by any means.

The Ys (prounounced Ees) series has long ben one of the finer series in Japanese action RPGs. It has been known for being one of the first game series to emphasize story, its brutal bosses,   fantastic rock soundtrack.....and barely ever being imported into the U.S. My own only experience with the series was Ys III, released in 1991, on the Sega Genesis

Ys Origins is a surprisingly polished game, considering its original release in 2006. With a focus on combat and dungeon exploration, the game feels familiar, but is polished enough to stay entertained enough through its campaign.

And what a campaign. Though a single character's story line is no longer than 8 to 9 hours, Ys Origins provides 3 different characters, each with a completely different fighting style, viewpoint in the story, and even differences in area accessability and boss battles. Combined with bonus time attack and boss rush modes, where devoted players can earn special costumes, battles, and even a bonus character, Ys Origin can easily be enjoyed for over 30 hours.

Ys Origin is not without flaws. The story is serviceable, but fairly predictable. Some later boss battles can be an exercise in frustration, and you'll wish that they mixed up the dungeons a bit more between characters. However, for anyone looking for a classic, rewarding, challenging action RPG with all of the Japanese trappings, you can do a lot worse than this artifact of the previous decade.

This is not the type of game I normally would enjoy, but I feel this game does so many things right.
1.  This game is tough, even on the normal difficulty level.  It is not unfair, just tough.
2.  There is a level mechanic, but the game relies more on skill and perseverance.
3.  The music, which is stereotypical Japanese power metal, still manages to be perfect for the setting and helps to add energy.
4.  There is a story, but it is more about playing the game then watching cut-scenes, instead of the other way around.
5.   Has some of the most insanely-fun boss battles in recent memory.  (Which the game knows as there is a boss rush mode).

I don't know what else to say.  Great game that takes around 15 hours to complete on normal.

The description for this game does NOT do it justice. The gameplay falls somewhere between Castlevania and Gauntlet. There are a ton of enemy types that each have a weakness for one of three weapons and the abilities that go with them. Infinitely refilling magic capabilities give you an edge against the onslaught. But most importantly, this is a game that rewards risk. That faster and more efficiently you defeat foes, the faster you level, going up to 2x speed. Oh, and the bosses? Classic gaming style oozes from them as you learn patterns and find the weakspots. I bought this blind and couldn't be happier. I haven't had this much fun with a game in a long, long time. BUY IT ALREADY.

Most of the dungeon tunes are technical speed metal obviously performed entirely on synths. Nonetheless it fits perfectly.\n\nAnd that's the thing with Ys Origin. All of the pieces come together and make a surprisingly excellent package. Highly Recommended!!

Ys Origin is an Japanese-style action RPG, set as a prequel to the Ys series. This is the first Ys game I've played, and I've definitely been enjoying it.

The game's combat system is the best part of it: normal enemies don't give you much of a challenge because they're easily stun-locked (as Yunica, at least), but the boss battles are intense. The bosses are difficult and they take a while to bring down even if you know what you're doing, but their attacks are easily predicted. It does take some skill to get through it, though (on Normal). The game's story and world are also interesting; it has one of the better game stories I've seen recently.

This game is definitely worth considering for any RPG fan, and I would recommend it even at full price to fans of the genre.

reviewText:
Probably the quickest I've ever gone from demo to purchase.

As Ys tends to go, it's a ballbuster, but a damn fun one.  Combat is surprisingly flexible for its simplicity.  The set piece boss fights are creative, complex, and completely unforgiving, but for the most part tuned very well -- a player who's practiced up can take them down reliably and feel like a total badass in the process.  Experience gain is tuned to scale based on the level difference between you and your opponent, so you catch up very quickly when underleveled but can always crank out an extra level for an edge against something.

There are exceptions, of course.  Kishgal is capable of randomly screwing you depending on which moves he does in succession, and a couple bosses (Gelaldy, Pictimos) are long and tedious enough to stop feeling fun after the first half of their HP bar.  The latter third of the game is extremely melee-unfriendly, and poor Yunica is largely reduced to spamming one special attack.

A challenging and rewarding Action RPG. The combat is incredibly smooth and fast-paced and it doesn't take long to start enjoying running down enemies left and right, unless they are the insane boss fights of course. It doesn't try to impress in the story department as much, but what it has is fine. I haven't even mentioned the incredible soundtrack that keeps you excited to continue forwards. Overall a difficult yet incredibly fun game that I will keep coming back to from time to time.

reviewText: This game really brigs me back to the SNES days of action RPGs. It has great, smooth gameplay, fantastic replayability, and a decent story. I've yet to play others in the series, but this game was a blast and a challenge!

Surprisingly fun action hack and slash zelda / bastion style game.  Easy levels but ridiculously hard boss fights, though ones that feel satisfying once you finally figure them out.  Anime style story with typical tropes for main characters (innocent idealist fighter and snobby cocky mage), though despite this has an interesting story that changes enough to warrant multiple playthroughs on other characters.

Grindy, storyless, extremely simple combat, single dungeon RPG. If you're looking for an RPG with a focus on boss battles that doesn't take 50 hours to run though, this a good choice. There's a bit of exploration but the goal is always clear: up. You can breeze through the game up until the bosses, at which point you have to spend some time grinding up to the proper level. No real loot, combat tactics, overworld, shops, or side quests to worry about. It's a real shut off your brain game, which is why I come to Ys.
Well worth 20 dollars for Ys fans. Non-Ys fans should play Oath in Felgana instead. Both are great games.

If you enjoy playing action role-playing games (particularly those from Japan), Ys Origin is a solid investment.  At first, the level designs and monsters were fairly basic, but this is not so much of an issue as you progress higher up the tower.  The amount of variety in the demon designs and floor designs later on isn't spectacular, but keep in mind this is all going on inside of a tower.  The bosses--I would say--are the only exception.  The level and skill system revolve around finding new equipment and gems.  Although simple in design, there is just enough variety to keep you interested.  The story itself is alright (at least to the point where I am at...), and the characters aren't too bad.  You won't be interacting with them too much anyway.  In order to improve your character's own abilities and the abilities of some of your weapons and other equipment, the game allows players to cash in the SP dropped by defeated demons.  This SP is cashed in at the game's Goddess statues, which also serve as save points.  Generally, the distance between these save points is just the right" distance.  If you don't know what difficulty to play at
date: I would recommend the "normal" difficulty setting.  Normal might seem too easy at first
recommended: but the game becomes significantly harder later on.  However
hoursPlayed: action RPG veterans will likely want to bump up the difficulty a notch or two.  If not at the normal price
voteText: then consider adding Ys Origin to your Steam library the next time the game is on sale."

The game is unique in that you have to play the game through 3 times to get the full story. There are 3 characters to play. Yunica, Hugo and Toal. Toal can only be played after you have completed the game with Yunica and Hugo, and rightfuly so as Toals playthrough contains the most story with couple plot twists even.

This game also has a very high replayability. It wont get boring to play through it several times. And after you beat the game there is also time attack mode, boss rush and arena where you can compete for leaderboards. In arena you also get points you can use in a bonus shop to buy alternative characters to play through the story with.

Really, I usually find something to nitpick at, but with Ys Origin, it's darn near impossible, since it's such a solid, satisfying title.

STORYLINE: 3/5
It's got an entertaining, although kind of cliche, anime-like storyline, that's enough to keep you feeling that you're actually making progress as you play. Nothing out of ordinary here, but not bad either.

CONTROLS: 5/5
It has fantastic controls. I just finished my first playthrough and started my second one (with another character) using an xbox controller and it plays just awesome. Responsive action, simple, yet rewarding controls. Maybe that's the best part of the whole game, it sounds kind of silly, but it just feels good to control the characters as you go. In a simple sentence: the game just feels amazing on your thumbs as you play.

GRAPHICS: 4/5
Pretty cool graphics that remind me of PS1's RPG games: anime-like portraits, Ragnarok like sprites, pretty good, overall. The in game effects (such as explosions and fire) are just okay, but the cutscenes are pretty good and nicely rendered.

GAMEPLAY: 5/5
A simple, intuitive item/level system, with very few choices to make. Reminds me a little of how DMC deals with this kind of thing: you get stronger as the enemies get stronger (no choices in stats), and your weapons compose a little, but handful, arsenal, which you'll have to switch around to get through various enemies/situations. I usually like this kind of system, since it gets me more focused on the gameplay, not on the mechanics, but I do feel they could have done with a little more variety, ability wise. Still, solid system, which absolutely doesn't get frustrating as you go (i.e. no grinding absolutely required, at least on normal dificulty playthroughs).

SOUND FX and MUSIC: 3/5
Music is pretty cool too, although a bit repetitive. Sound effects are what you'd expect from this kind of game, adds to the good feeling you get from hacking at an enemy (could have used the rumble feature on a controller, though).

OVERALL:  4/5
Overall, I give this game a solid 4 out of 5 score. It's not a Steam MUST PLAY, but you definitely won't regret going through a couple of playthroughs. If you like old school PS1 RPGs and don't mind (or actually prefer) having little to no control over your character's status and are rather just there for the fun of the combat, I DEFINITELY recommend you get this one.
It's a fun prequel to the series. The game starts off really easy and simple but then puts you right into the firing range shortly after. It feels like an old classic RPG all over again.

What this game lacks in exploration compared to Oath in Felghana and Ark of Napishtim, it more than makes up for with the skills/upgrade-system and the playable characters who each have their own distinct style which makes for a very varied experience.\n\nSolid combat, excellent soundtrack and a lot of content for your money's worth makes Ys: Origin a must-have.

Probably the game I had the most fun playing in the series so far. Instead of focusing on Adol, this prequel has 3 different characters, and although their routes share many places and events there is enough variety to keep things fresh. As is expected from the series, the soundtack is top notch and controls are fluid and responsive. Totally recommended to any fans of great action rpgs.

Not like other Y's series games..this one has no towns and only one location to fight at. The story is also different with different characters to choose from. Do not consider this how normal Y's games are if you using this to compare to other games in the series..

Nice gameplay and decent bosses with mechanics that are quite challenging for very casual gamers. opening cutscene was quite long but gave me some decent background on the game.\n\nA little bit grindy at times if you need a few levels to beat a boss (like 20-30 mins xp farm) and its quite easy to get stuck if you havent explored properly and opened all the chests.

With its simple 3D environments, beautiful 2d sprite characters and cheesy but epically wonderful music, YS origins reminds me of something that I’d have played on the original PlayStation or the Sega Saturn.  And I mean that as a huge compliment.

Caked in classic JRPG atmosphere, simple but lush graphics and addictive arcade style gameplay, YS Origin should yet al the buttons for JRPG fans.  You get a choice of (eventually) 3 characters, all with different playstyles,  and each character follows a different branch of the main story from a slightly different perspective, which means you’ll probably at his for 30 hours to complete all three storylines, which is just enough for this kinda game.  YS forsakes the turn-based combat of most JRPGS for an arcade-action style of button mashing mayhem.  The combat system isn’t very deep, but it’s a hell of a lot of fun in the way that something like Golden Axe or Gauntlet was in the 80s, and magical effects are really beautiful.  However, what really impressed my about YS Origin is the quality of the PC port; its got graphics options galore, has been properly adjusted for PC monitors, supports keyboard and gamepads (go with a gamepad, trust me), and it runs at a constant smooth framerate. Hopefully, Japanese developers will take notice, and this quality of port will become the norm.

Fancy a blast down nostalgia lane?  Got an itch for  an action JRPG with simple but addictive gameplay?  Give this a try.
